title: Vikings' Gustaf Skarsgard basically says Floki is dead ahead season 6
text:
Vikings’ Gustaf Skarsgård basically confirms Floki is dead (Picture: History)

Vikings star Gustaf Skarsgård has basically confirmed Floki’s death, and we are more than shook.

The last time we saw the fan favourite was in episode 19 of season five, titled What Happened In The Cave.

After losing his faith in the Gods, the much-loved character went searching for answers in an Icelandic cave – as you do.

And after hoping he would find what he was looking for, he came across the Christain symbol of a cross and fell to his knees as he wailed out in disbelief.

His screams caused an avalanche, that barricaded him underground, and while viewers were left hoping he would somehow escape, it seems the episode had actually sealed his fate.

Taking to Instagram ahead of the final season, Floki star Gustaf revealed his excitement for the finale as well as teasing his character’s end.

We are shook (Picture: History)

He wrote to his 829,000 followers: ‘Who’s ready for season six? Floki might not have made it out of the cave but I’m as excited as the rest of you to follow the fates of all the other characters!

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Hail King Björn! Premieres on Dec 4!’

Fans were quick to comment and refused to believe this was the last of Floki.

‘FLOKI IS ALIVE NO ONE CAN CHANGE MY MIND,’ one wrote in necessary capitals, while another added: ‘Floki can’t die!!! You gotta be kidding!’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Someone else said: ‘He deffo made it out the cave, don’t do that to us.’

Fan theories then started to circulate that the character would return to Kattegat with Ivar The Boneless, as another assumed that Floki would reappear as a God.

Earlier this week, fans were treated to a full-length trailer for the upcoming and final series of Vikings.

Floki is not seen in the teaser, however, he is mentioned as his settlers say they want to search for their leader.

Explaining his whereabouts, Kjetill Flatnose (played by Adam Copeland) says: ‘You can search all you want, you will not find him.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Vikings returns to the History Channel and Amazon Prime on 4 December.

description: Vikings' Gustaf Skarsgård basically confirms Floki is dead ahead of season 6, and we refuse to believe it.
